item.title: BTC: UK’s economic security regime “not fit for the future” – and risks becoming weak point in the West
item.description: Committee calls for Economic Security Bill to enshrine the approach set out in new Report in law, with the appointment of a dedicated Economic Security Minister.

item.title: What’s really behind the UK’s growth problem? Help the BTC help Government to fix it
item.description: Committee launches second annual roadshow on its priorities for growth with call for evidence

item.title: As Trump visits the UK for an unprecedented second State Visit, it’s time for “maximum pressure” to secure trade and technology alliance
item.description: In a report today the Commons Business and Trade Committee says President Trump’s State Visit is the moment to maximise pressure on the United States to agree final terms of a full Economic Prosperity Deal that will end sectoral uncertainty, secure critical supply chains and drive investment into the UK.

item.title: “No tweaks at the margins. Britain needs a new architecture of investment for a new age of risk” - BTC launches new inquiry on financing the real economy
item.description: In a new inquiry the Business and Trade Committee will examine the causes of the UK’s persistent underinvestment and explore how the UK can raise capital formation by mobilising greater levels of private and public finance—domestic and foreign—into British firms and infrastructure.

item.title: Committee welcomes the Horizon IT Inquiry Report, urges Government to “close painful chapter of history” and speed up justice for victims of Post Office Horizon scandal
item.description: The Business and Trade Committee welcomes the first report of the Post Office Horizon IT Inquiry published today. The recommendations of this report mirror much of what the Committee has called for – improvement of redress schemes, in particular the Horizon Shortfall Scheme, the need to speed up redress payments and the need for free, upfront legal advice to be available to all victims.

item.title: Britain Must Seize the Asia-Pacific Moment
item.description: Over the next five years, £7 trillion of new wealth will be created across Asia-Pacific— a quarter of global forecast growth and more than the entire GDP of the United Kingdom.

item.title: BTC report: how the UK can unlock access to Asia-Pacific markets worth £trillions
item.description: A quarter of global economic growth will come from the region in the next five years, even excluding China

item.title: Industrial Strategy - BTC Chair Liam Byrne comments
item.description: Commenting on the newly published Industrial Strategy and ahead of its debate in the House of Commons this afternoon

item.title: What do small businesses really need now to drive the growth mission and keep our high streets thriving?
item.description: Small business is very big business in the UK. Covering the range from sole entrepreneurs to enterprises with up to 250 employees, small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) make up 99.8% of all UK businesses.

item.title: Industrial Strategy must deliver sweeping public-private reforms - and lower energy costs - or ministers will miss ‘once in a century’ opportunity for British economy
item.description: The House of Commons Business and Trade Committee warns that a “once in a century” opportunity for the British economy will be lost unless the Industrial Strategy is ‘funded to work’.

item.title: ‘The Brussels Dividend’: Commons Committee urges strategic reset with Europe to unlock growth and security
item.description: Ahead of the landmark "EU reset” summit on Monday 19 May the BTC is publishing its three pillars for negotiation to kickstart new, security and growth-driving relations with the European Union.

item.title: Rt Hon Liam Byrne Chair of the Business and Trade Committee statement on reports of US-UK Deal
item.description: Rt Hon Liam Byrne Chair of the Business and Trade Committee statement on reports of US-UK Deal

item.title: Does the UK really know how to ‘do’ national economic security?
item.description: The Business & Trade Committee will this week throw new light on the threat to UK economic security with hearings that convene some of the country’s top security experts from the public, private and investment sectors.

item.title: How can a nation so rich in brains and banks be so poor at building world-beating businesses?
item.description: In widely reported evidence to the BTC’s ongoing inquiry into the UK’s industrial strategy, auto executives warned that Donald Trump’s tariffs could lead to thousands of British manufacturing layoffs within “weeks rather than months”, as they called for a major intervention from Government to support the industry.

item.title: As tariffs bite, where next for the UK’s growth-driving industries?
item.description: BP plc and more to be questioned on the business and economics of the clean energy transition

item.title: 20 ways to fix Brexit’s growth hit: BTC report
item.description: As President Trump sets out sweeping global tariff barriers and ahead of the May summit between Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen aimed at resetting UK-EU relations, the BTC is publishing a draft ‘Green Paper’ setting out twenty ways the UK and the EU can reset their relationship for mutual benefit.

item.title: Business and Trade Committee’s ‘5 tests’ for a strategy to secure British steel
item.description: The Committee has written urgently to Business Secretary Jonathan Reynolds to set out 5 tests for a strategy to support the UK steel industry ahead of Donald Trump’s self-styled “Liberation Day” potentially imposing widespread tariff barriers to global trade.

item.title: Still unfinished business: BTC asks Government to ‘reflect and revise’ Post Office Horizon redress plan
item.description: The Business and Trade Committee is today taking the unusual step of asking the Government to ‘reflect and revise’ its response to its January 1st report on finally achieving long-delayed justice and redress for victims of the Post Office Horizon IT scandal – described as the greatest miscarriage of justice in UK history.

item.title: How to stop the UK being abused as a global cash laundromat?
item.description: MPs on the Business and Trade Sub-Committee on Economic Security, Arms and Export Controls will hear evidence on efforts to clamp down on the criminal abuse of the UK’s register of companies

item.title: Steel ‘trade war serves no-one’ – Business and Trade Committee Chair
item.description: The Chair of the influential Business and Trade Committee has urged the Government to push to secure tariff exceptions after the US began enforcing higher tariffs across the board on steel.
